title: Academic Poster Logistics & Inventory Coordinator
description: Coordinate and track physical poster printing schedules, material inventories, transport logistics, and collaborator task assignments for academic conference poster presentations.
inputLabel: Enter your event, poster, inventory, transport, and collaborator details below (JSON or plain text):
outputLabel: Generated consolidated schedules, packing checklists, inventory alerts, and task summaries:
systemPrompt: You are an expert academic poster logistics assistant. Given input about conference events, poster specs, printing vendors, inventory items, transport logistics, and collaborator responsibilities, you generate consolidated printing and material schedules, inventory usage alerts with reorder recommendations, transport packing checklists per event, and collaborator task deadline summaries. You must validate inputs strictly: dates must be consistent, quantities non-negative, emails valid, and no conflicting events or deadlines. Refuse any input requesting venue compliance management or poster content creation. Output plain text summaries or JSON if requested. Never expose sensitive contact data beyond what the user provides. Enforce safety and data integrity rules carefully.

presets.label: Summary Schedule
presets.prompt: Generate a consolidated multi-event poster printing and material request schedule from the input data, highlighting print deadlines and shipment dates.
presets.hint: Use this to get a high-level timeline overview.

presets.label: Inventory Status & Alerts
presets.prompt: Analyze the inventory data provided and generate usage summaries, reorder alerts, and recommendations to optimize material reuse.
presets.hint: Use this to track supplies and avoid shortages.

presets.label: Packing Checklist
presets.prompt: Create an event-specific packing checklist based on poster specifications and inventory usage logs, including transport materials needed.
presets.hint: Use this to prepare physical materials for each event.

presets.label: Collaborator Task Overview
presets.prompt: Summarize collaborator assignments, upcoming task deadlines, and potential conflicts from the input task and contact data.
presets.hint: Use this to monitor team responsibilities and deadlines.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured-output is enabled, respond with JSON including fields: schedules, inventoryAlerts, packingChecklist, tasksSummary.
clarifyPrompt: Please provide missing or unclear details about your events, posters, inventory, transport logistics, or collaborator assignments. Ensure dates and quantities are accurate.
finalizePrompt: Confirm that all event, poster, inventory, transport, and collaborator data is complete and accurate before generating the consolidated logistics output.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Poster Material Logistics & Inventory Coordinator

niche.role: Academic conference poster presenter and research lab manager
niche.scenario: Coordinating and tracking physical poster printing, transport, and display materials logistics for recurring academic conferences or multiple simultaneous events

idea.problem: Academic researchers frequently present posters at multiple conferences and must manage complex logistics involving printing vendors, material inventories (e.g., poster tubes, stands, adhesives), transport arrangements, and deadlines. Existing tools focus on poster content creation or design quality but do not support the end-to-end physical preparation and logistics coordination workflow. Manual tracking leads to missed deadlines, lost materials, duplicated orders, and inefficient reuse of supplies.
inputs: Conference event dates and venue logistics
Poster specifications (size, format, printing vendor details)
Inventory data for poster-related physical materials (tubes, stands, labels, adhesives)
Shipping and transport schedules or constraints
Collaborator and presenter contact info and responsibilities
outputs: Consolidated multi-event poster printing and material request schedules
Inventory usage and replenishment alerts with reorder recommendations
Transport packing checklists customized per event
Collaborator task assignment and deadline tracking dashboards
Alerts for potential conflicts (e.g., overlapping deadlines, insufficient materials)
whyItWins: Fills a unique gap by focusing on physical poster logistics rather than content or presentation aspects
Supports repeated, multi-event workflows common to active research groups
Improves resource utilization by tracking inventory and enabling material reuse
Facilitates team coordination with transparent task tracking and role assignments
Reduces costly errors like missed print deadlines or forgotten materials at venues

upgradePath.today: Lightweight single-page tool to manually input event, poster, and inventory details, generating packing lists and schedules
upgradePath.in90Days: Add collaborative multi-user management with shared dashboards, automated email reminders, and vendor integration for print order status tracking
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop comprehensive multi-event logistics system with transport vendor APIs, barcode inventory scanning, real-time status tracking, predictive inventory forecasting, and mobile app support for on-the-go coordination

riskNotes: Requires secure handling of potentially sensitive collaborator contact data
Dependent on user diligence for timely data entry to maintain accuracy
Logistics variability by conference may require flexible customization options
Not a substitute for venue-specific compliance or shipping regulations

blueprint.summary: A multi-event academic poster logistics and inventory coordination system that manages physical poster printing, material inventory, transport arrangements, and collaborator task tracking to reduce errors and improve resource utilization.
blueprint.primaryUser: Academic conference poster presenters and research lab managers coordinating multiple events and teams
successMetrics: Reduction in missed print deadlines and forgotten materials at events
Improved inventory utilization and reduced redundant orders
Increased on-time task completion rates by collaborators
User adoption and frequency of multi-event coordination usage
Positive user feedback on ease of logistics management

edgeCases: Overlapping event dates causing resource conflicts
Inventory usage logged after event completion or with incorrect quantities
Collaborator contact info changes or invalid email addresses
Printing vendor delays or changes in print deadlines
Partial data entry or missing required fields
Simultaneous edits by multiple users causing race conditions
Transport logistics changes close to event dates
Users ignoring or disabling email reminders
nonGoals: Venue-specific shipping compliance or customs regulation management
Poster content creation or design tools
Real-time transport tracking in the initial version
Mobile app support in the initial release
Automated vendor order placement without user confirmation

dataFlow: User authenticates and accesses UI pages requiring authentication.
Dashboard UI fetches aggregated data from /api/events, /api/posters, /api/inventory, and /api/tasks filtered by user context.
Event & Poster Management UI sends create/update requests to /api/events and /api/posters, validating date and venue logistics before submission.
Inventory Management UI fetches inventory data from /api/inventory and posts usage logs to /api/inventory/usage, handling concurrency and reorder alerts.
Task & Collaborator Management UI fetches collaborators and tasks from /api/collaborators and /api/tasks, posts task assignments to /api/tasks, enforcing auth and notifying users.
Packing Checklist page requests event-specific data to generate packing lists based on posters and inventory usage.

Background jobs run independently: Deadline Reminder Job queries tasks and collaborators via /api-collaborators to send emails respecting preferences; Inventory Reorder Alert Job analyzes inventory via /api-inventory and triggers reorder alerts.
APIs validate inputs, enforce authorization, handle concurrency, and return structured responses or errors to UIs.
UI components display data, alerts, and notifications based on API responses and background job outputs.
validationRules: Event dates: startDate must be before or equal to endDate; no overlapping events for the same user at the same venue.
Poster printDeadline must be before event endDate and after event startDate.
Vendor contactEmail must be a valid email format; phone optional but if present must be valid format.
Inventory quantityOnHand and reorderThreshold must be non-negative integers; usage logs quantityUsed must be positive and not exceed quantityOnHand at log time.
Task dueDate must be in the future or present; status must be one of predefined states (e.g., pending, in-progress, completed).
Collaborator email must be valid; phone optional but validated if present.
All create/update API requests must include required fields; partial data rejected with clear error messages.
Concurrent inventory updates must be serialized or use optimistic concurrency control to prevent race conditions.
Authentication required for all protected API routes; authorization checks ensure users can only access or modify their own data.
Input dates and strings sanitized to prevent injection or malformed data.
errorHandling: API routes return HTTP 400 for validation errors with detailed messages per field.
API routes return HTTP 401 for unauthorized access attempts.
API routes return HTTP 404 when requested resources (e.g., event, poster) do not exist or do not belong to the user.
API routes return HTTP 409 for conflicts such as overlapping events or concurrent inventory update conflicts.
Background jobs log failures and retry sending emails or alerts with exponential backoff; failures do not block system operation.
UI displays user-friendly error messages and highlights invalid inputs on forms.
API responses include error codes and messages in JSON to allow UI to handle gracefully.
System logs critical errors for monitoring and debugging.
Race conditions handled by database transactions or locking mechanisms where applicable.
securityNotes: All API routes require authentication; use JWT or session-based auth consistent with Next.js best practices.
Authorization checks ensure users can only access and modify their own events, posters, inventory, collaborators, and tasks.
Collaborator contact data is handled securely; sensitive data not exposed to unauthorized users.
Email sending respects user notification preferences and privacy.
Input validation and sanitization prevent injection attacks.
Use HTTPS for all client-server communications.
Background jobs run with least privilege and secure access to APIs and email services.
Rate limiting on APIs to prevent abuse.
Store sensitive configuration such as email credentials and API keys in environment variables.

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user with no existing events
acceptanceTests.when: They create a new event with valid dates and venue
acceptanceTests.then: The event is created successfully and appears in their event list

acceptanceTests.given: An event exists with a defined date range
acceptanceTests.when: The user attempts to create another event overlapping the same venue and dates
acceptanceTests.then: The API rejects the creation with a conflict error indicating overlapping event dates

acceptanceTests.given: A poster is created with a printDeadline after the event endDate
acceptanceTests.when: The user submits the poster data
acceptanceTests.then: The API returns a validation error preventing the poster creation

acceptanceTests.when: A usage log is submitted to use 15 units
acceptanceTests.then: The API rejects the usage log with an error indicating insufficient inventory

acceptanceTests.given: A collaborator has tasks due tomorrow
acceptanceTests.when: The Deadline Reminder Job runs at 8 AM
acceptanceTests.then: The collaborator receives an email reminder respecting their notification preferences

acceptanceTests.given: Inventory items have quantities below reorderThreshold
acceptanceTests.when: The Inventory Reorder Alert Job runs weekly
acceptanceTests.then: Reorder alerts are generated and visible in the dashboard UI

acceptanceTests.given: A user attempts to access /dashboard without authentication
acceptanceTests.then: They are redirected to the login page

acceptanceTests.given: Multiple users attempt to update the same inventory item simultaneously
acceptanceTests.then: The system prevents race conditions and maintains consistent inventory quantities

acceptanceTests.given: A user submits a task with missing required fields
acceptanceTests.then: The API returns a 400 error with field-specific validation messages

acceptanceTests.given: A user views the packing checklist page and selects an event
acceptanceTests.then: A packing checklist is generated accurately based on posters and inventory usage logs for that event
